document.docAuthor: Cianferoni, Fabio, Saleem, Rukhshanda, Afsheen, Sumera & Zia, Ahmed
document.masterDocTitle: The water striders of Pakistan (Hemiptera: Heteroptera: Gerridae): new records from Punjab and first checklist for the country

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The water striders of Pakistan (Hemiptera: Heteroptera: Gerridae): new records from Punjab and first checklist for the country

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Metrocoris stali : Oshanin, 1912: 86
[nec Dohrn, 1860 ]. Misidentification.—
Pakistan :
Pruthi (1933: 98
, 99, 101. Punjab Province , Jhelum District, Khewra Gorge) as
Metrocoris ståli (Dohrn)
. Misidentifications.

Metrocoris omanensis Brown 1950: 477
. Syn.
den Boer (1965: 13)
.

Rheumatobates maculata Khatoon & Ali 1978: 489
.
Syn. nov.— Pakistan :
Khatoon & Ali (1978: 489
, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa Province ?, “Kabul river”; Punjab Province , Rawalpindi District, “Wah streams”; province?, “stream near Coca-Cola Factory”);
Saleem & Begum (1985: 326
, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa Province , Malakand District, Shahkot, Alif Kali).

Remarks. Reported here are the first formal records for Pakistan (see Chen & Nieser 1993 ,
Basu et al. 2016a
,
Román-Palacios et al. 2020
). Although Pruthi (1933) recorded
Metrocoris ståli (Dohrn)
for Punjab , this was a misidentification of
M. communis
(see list above for further detail).

This is a dimorphic species, with the apterous morph more common than the infrequently collected macropterous morph (see Jehamalar & Chandra 2013 , Khazaei & Sadeghi 2018 ). The frequency of winged/wingless specimens is less than 1% (0.95%) in our recorded samples (n = 628); the proportion is slightly higher in the material from India by Jehamalar & Chandra (2013) and from Iran by Khazaei & Sadeghi (2018) : 1.92% (n = 104) and 4.65% (n = 172), respectively. The macropterous morph was described and figured only recently by Jehamalar & Chandra (2013) on specimens from India . Later, Khazaei & Sadeghi (2018) illustrated and re-described these morphs with greater detail, based on specimens from Iran , but overlooked the previous work.

Taxonomic note. Khatoon & Ali (1978) described a new species of Gerridae from Pakistan , naming it
Rheumatobates maculata
, based on insects collected near Kabul River and a few other streams, although it lacked details about the number of specimens and exact localities. The proposed species was assigned to the New World genus
Rheumatobates Bergroth, 1892
and the specific epithet was not in agreement with the male gender of the genus. This new taxon was overlooked by subsequent authors, probably due to lack of access to the publication. The brief description provided was inadequate (see Discussion section for details). The specimen that was figured ( Khatoon & Ali 1978 , plate 1, fig. 3) reasonably corresponds to
Metrocoris communis
on the basis of the fore legs and antennae and colour pattern (evidenced by a shape in the drawing in black and white) of the pronotum and head. Moreover,
M. communis
is the easternmost species of
Metrocoris Mayr, 1865
. As such, we propose
Rheumatobates maculata Khatoon & Ali, 1978
as a junior synonym of
Metrocoris communis (Distant, 1910)
.
